page.title: 10Game keeper's house
page.content: The old game keeper's house was built between 1820 and 1840. It was part of the Wantage Estate and was built by Lady Overstone. The stables and the kennels for the hounds used for hunting by guests of the Wantages were next door. The gateway at the top of the road was one of the ways to the Wantage's Estate.The Pytchley Gates were the main entrance to the House. The house stands in four acres of land including a small wood behind the building. There is a long drive leading to the house. It is about five minutes walking distance from the village school.
